text: Would not recommend these guys. Very shady company. They overcharge big time especially if you are some sort of business. The invoices they create are very unprofessional. Just lump the entire total into one. When I asked to break it down I ended up receiving an invoice that had it all broken down. They charge you for labor that you can not even see them do. It’s call in shop labor on their invoice. Supposedly they do 4 hours of work within the shop for something that still had to be assembled in the shop. Personally having done different business in different state I have never ran into a glass company that just seemed to do things this way.  Doesn’t seem legitimate.

text: I am so thankful for the Window and Door Pros!! My father's home was recently burglarized and a window was smashed to gain entry. I heard the owner on the phone with my dad and he was so kind and reassuring in dealing with him.  It is so good to know that there are still people out there who care and help those in difficult times and are not just concerned about profit.  Thank you so much!

resp.text: Thanks Sarah! We were glad we could help!

name: Ted Bell
text: Called this joke of a company on a Monday to get an estimate on a door frame repair. The woman that answered told me a "Danny" would call me back to set up an appointment. So I wait , next day nothing,  so I wait and on Friday I call back and this same lady acts like she didn't get the message to Danny somehow so she has this guy call me. Ok , big Danny calls me says he is on the way to some other address that's not even mine. Anyway I give him my address he says oh yeah I can be there between 3 and 4 pm. Never shows up, never calls , nothing. Hey window and door so called pros. If you don't want to take a job how about do the decent thing and let a customer know that from the beginning, but no these goofs from window and door pros will string you along and leave you hanging. Stay away from these people, total joke.

resp.text: I sincerely apologize for your poor experience.  Sometimes things get crazy around here and we get overwhelmed with emergencies and calls.  It is never our intention to overlook a potential customer.  Thank you for letting us know we need to improve our services.  I completely understand your frustrations. Again, I really do apologize and will strive to do better in the future.

name: eric malone
text: Good and very professional..Thanks... you have my business...

name: Christopher Allison
text: I asked this company to give an estimate for repairs.  They came to my home, inspected the windows, then never called back.  Thanks to their non response, the buyers of my home then requested all windows be replaced.  The owner of Window and Door pros came back to my house two weeks later, which he vaguely recalled, and gave an estimate of $12,000 to replace the windows because he said they could not be repaired.  However, he would not put the estimate in writing, so my contract with the buyers became null and void.  After the fact, I did some research and found the replacement balances for my windows form Swisco for all of $300.00 to repair 16 windows in my home.  This company is as dishonest as they come.  The owner was more interested in talking about his cool upgrades to his Ford F150 than he was about fixing my windows.  I would never use this company for any repair unless you want to be treated poorly and taken advantage of!!!!!

resp.text: We are so happy to hear you found replacement parts for your windows because the original manufacture is no longer in business and we were unable to purchase parts from them.  We wanted to be honest and not give an estimate in writing for the future owners if we would be unable to complete the work. We felt like that would be dishonest to give an estimate that we were unable to honor in the future. We vocalized this to your father as well as sent him an email.  We  certainly apologize for any miscommunication on our part.   It's just very important to us to not give an estimate in writing if we cannot honor it.

name: Katrina Hutchins
text: Called to ask about a quote, $80 before any measuring done and at least 2 weeks before coming out to do the quote.... but when the girl on the phone heard that I’d have to call her back without hearing why, she hangs up in my ear!!😡 I’m definitely not calling back now!

resp.text:
Katrina, we have a large area of North Alabama where we provide free estimates at absolutely no cost to the customer.  It includes 72 different zip code areas and most of the metropolitan areas. Unfortunately your home is in Gurley which is not included in the free estimate area.

Our typical time to get out to jobs for estimates has historically been one or two days maximum.  It’s a source of pride for us.  But during Covid many people have chosen to stay home and upgrade their homes.  Unfortunately, like all businesses that specialize in home remodeling, we have a backlog of several weeks of work.  We have been working overtime to get our lead times back to normal and are making headway in catching up.

We offer our sincere apology for any inconvenience this has caused.  We feel it’s more important to be honest and upfront about the current backlog than to promise quicker lead times and then fail to deliver on them.

We have had problems with our VOIP phone system all day, experiencing several dropped calls. Again, we apologize if this has caused any of our customers to feel anything less than important.

text: We (Alabama Cabinets) uses Madison Glass weekly to fill our glass needs.  Every time I call Ciera or Stephanie are always quick to answer the phone with a smile and go above and beyond for us. name: Casey G
text:
We had a great experience with Madison Glass Company.

We recently replaced the builder grade shower in our master bathroom with a new tile shower. After the tiling was complete, I reached out to five different companies in the area to come give me quotes on a glass shower door and surround as well as an interior window pane for an insulated double pane window that one of kids had managed to crack.

Out of all five companies that came out, I felt like Wade and Kevin from Madison glass were the only ones that tried to assess the job and recommend the best solution for us. They were the only one of the five companies that realized there was not a stud behind the tile where the door was to be installed and actually recommended a solution that ended up saving us money (though they also made sure I knew they were capable of going with the more expensive solution if we decided to go that route).

Using the information that they provided, I was able to go back and get a slightly cheaper quote from one of the other companies. Despite that, I went with Madison Glass because I felt I could trust Wade and Kevin to do the job right. I'm glad I did.

We had a small hiccup with the manufacturer on the first replacement window and shower door that came in, but Wade and Kevin set us up for the mean time and made sure to prioritize getting back out as soon as the replacement glass came in.

The shower looks great, the service was excellent, they let us know what to expect and then kept us informed throughout the process, and we ended up spending less than what we expected. I have already recommended them to a friend and will certainly use them in the future.

resp.text: We understand that it is difficult to find honest, dependable help. As a company, we want integrity to be the norm, not the exception. With custom installations, there are bound to be a few bumps in the road, but it's the way people handle those bumps that truly matter. I'm glad we were able to come through for you!

name: Daniel Weatherford
text:
Tired of looking at a frosty window.

Pros: Price

Cons: Talks a good talk, but doesn't stand by warranty.

Unfortunately, I would not recommend. Had a 5'x6' window installed on ground level. Installers caulked the outer edges of the window before installing and proceeded to set it on the ground to get a better grip, I guess, picking up mulch and clippings in the sealant. Then seated it with the debris in the seal. I didn't complain and there were no leaks. I forgot about it.

Less than 2 years later, the whole window is completely frosted. Called July 10th about warranty on window, was told there would be a warranty on the window. Took a week for him to pull the paper work. Took almost two weeks for him to call the manufacturer one time, only to leave a VM. No follow up call to them for a week. I've called about twice a week every week since this started and am getting no where. Coming up on a month and has not even made contact with someone at the manufacturer.

Buyer beware.

When my SUV got T-boned in an intersection while on vacation, I was very apprehensive about my vehicle being worked on in an unfamiliar town by someone I'd never heard of. But Tony personally kept me updated, worked directly with the insurance company, and exceeded my wildest expectations as far as quality of work. When I went back to get my vehicle (three weeks later - yeah, it really got messed up), it looked and drove like nothing had ever happened! Paint was a perfect match, every detail was attended to! WELL DONE, TONY!

Nothing personal, but I naturally hope I don't get in another collision in northeast Alabama... but if I do, trust me: I know exactly where my vehicle is going for repairs and restoration.

name: harlee smith
text:
Keith is AH-MAY-ZING! He is not just a windshield "dentist" - he is a windshield miracle worker!! My husband and I were traveling to Tuscaloosa the day before, and a rock hit the windshield of our Mercedes and instantly created about a quarter-sized "firework" (my word - not the technical one, I'm sure!) On the Saturday of Memorial Day weekend, he let us come to his house and we were ready-to-roll in about 15 minutes ... and with a windshield where I could not even identify where the crack was previously!

On another note, we had had a much smaller one previously repaired a few weeks ago, by a "big name" company. And although they were extremely nice and did a good job, I can still see where that one was located - and as I said, it was a MUCH less destructive crack than the one Keith literally erased from our windshield.

Very nice man - great work - great price - in-and-out in 15 minutes. Cannot ask for more.

Keith is also a headlight magician!  He restored her headlights and they literally look brand new.  I have literally spent hundreds of dollars trying to do it myself to no avail.

text: I have tried for two years to have a glass company come and look at a custom made double paned window that needed the inside glass replaced.  No luck.  Then I thought I will try one more time. text: We are repeat customers - this is our second glass shower door installed by Huntsville Glass, and we are extremely pleased. The second door - a slider door, is only a week old, but we are loving it. If we needed a third shower door, I would call Huntsville Glass! Over the years, I've also had various pieces of picture frame glass and mirror glass cut to size and had excellent service too. Thanks to installers John and Curtis!

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know you have had a great overall experience with us over the years Debbie. We are always glad to hear our technicians and staff are taking great care of our customers. We look forward to continuing to help you with your glass and mirror needs!

name: Sheryl Payne
text: Recently a rock got flung toward my storm door while the front yard was being mowed.  I had one of those decorative films on the window pane that actually kept the glass from shattering everywhere. I called HSV Glass and working with the support team was very easy. I accepted the estimate and 3 weeks later my new window pane is installed. Mr. John May and Mr. James Davis, Sr. came out this morning and did a great job of removing the old shattered pane and installing the new one.  I was told to let the window 'set' for about 24 hours to really let the seal do it's job and after that I can put a new film on if I wanted.  I really appreciate the work the guys did and of the great customer support /service from Ms. Sherri.

resp.text: Sheryl, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. We understand that dealing with the unexpected can be difficult. So glad to hear that we provided such service.

text:
I wanted to share my testimony. It’s long but it just shows how much this company cares.

I took my broken window glass to Huntsville Glass for repair. They gave me a temporary one because it would take around five weeks for permanent fixture to  return for pickup.  During this time, I took my bent screen frame to them, or so I thought.  I was told they were unable to do the work and referred me to another company in Huntsville.  Due to my poor memory, I forgot about the conversation. I called to inquiry when would the work be completed. They searched and searched around their facility and couldn’t find it.  To make a long story short, they went the extra mile and called other glass and screen repair companies. They found my screen, through their tireless efforts, they coordinated with those companies to get it repaired. Then, they called me and told me where it was and gave me the number. I was so impressed and I felt bad because I thought they had it.  I apologized and to my surprise, they were very kind and patient with me.

I said all of that to say this!!!!! THIS COMPANY CARES ABOUT YOU AND YOUR BUSINESS!!!!!’ Thank you all for being so professional and patient with me.

resp.text: Its great to know that some businesses still care about their customers. It is an honor to be included in that prestigious group.

name: Stephanie Newton
text:
I decided to use A Glass Company from the great reviews on Google. I called and received a quote over the phone to replace my windshield. The price was well below Safelite and about average with other quotes. I made an appointment for the next morning and it was ready by noon.  Overall, the entire process was very simple, quick and to the point. The staff were friendly and professional. The inside of the business was also clean and tidy.

I do have one complaint though, and I try my best not to give poor reviews. Also, seeing that 90% of the reviews are good, maybe it was just a fluke, but important to note nonetheless. When I picked up the car, the windshield placement looked fine (from what a non experienced person could tell) but the inside dash had a layer of fine and semi-fine glass shards mixed with rubber debris. It was even inside my air vents so I couldn't turn on the air for fear that the glass particles would end up all over me. Also there were some on the floor and cup holders. I had to clean this up immediately once I got home. I wouldn't have minded so much if it was just plastic/rubber debris, because I've come to expect when you have work done on your car, they leave a little mess, but this was glass and that is not acceptable.

resp.text:
Stephanie,

I truly apologize for your vehicle not being cleaned to your satisfaction.  You are absolutely correct that this is unacceptable.  We always clean up any debris that is caused by the installation, but for some reason it was overlooked on your vehicle and I apologize.  Our goal is for all our customers to have a 5 star experience.  I have emphasized this with all of our glass technicians to be sure that this does not occur again.  Thank you for your business and I can assure you that if you need our services again this will not be an issue.  Thank you for your input as this will help us to improve so all of our customer have a 5 star experience.

Thank you,

Bill
A+ Glass Company, LLC

text: Terrible! Took Keith a classic vehicle,a windshield, the rubber and trim.  He said he could install the  windshield, no problem. He installed everything & it was horrible looking! The rubber was all crimped and bunched up between the windshield and trim, the trim didn't match up at all and had black goop all over it! It was a complete mess! Took it back to him to try and get it fixed & he said he was finished with it. My husband called him and asked him what he could do about it, Keith laid the phone down and walked off! If you cant stand behind your work, you shouldn't be in business. We ALWAYS stand behind out work that we do at our shop! If our customer isn't happy, we fix it, even if we lose money. Its worth the customer being happy!

resp.text:
Wendy,@ NuVintage Corvette,It is true that you brought me a windshield,gasket, and trim, but not the car.What you are not saying is these parts were aftermarket and you had previously installed them on a car.That makes them used aftermarket parts, which I charged you $100.00 to put together. I cannot and will not warranty the fit and function of your used parts. I am not sure why you would use used parts on a "$80k Car" your words.. Had you chosen to do the job with quality parts, the cost would have been $4850.00. But I am sure your customer would have been happy with the outcome of his vintage corvette.
Have a blessed day, Joy @A Glass Company

name: Dan Keys
text:
I needed to replace the windshield on my car after a tree branch cracked it.  As I was not filing an insurance claim, I was eager to find someone who would do a top notch job and not have to pay dealership prices.  I almost went with a nationally known auto glass company but found several positive reviews about A Glass Co.  I was a bit astonished at how much cheaper he could do it, using quality parts.  Glad I decided to give the local guy my business.
Keith explained my options on the phone about what quality glass to use (I went with the OEM brand), and let me know we could go with the slower drying adhesive for a super strong seal.  He did a great job, got it fixed at the shop in about 3 hours.  I felt like if anything wasn't to my satisfaction, he would make it right.  I would recommend this shop to anyone in the Huntsville area.

text: Three to four months after being replaced, the windshield cracked starting at the very bottom where nothing could have hit it. It was cracked on the inside of the vehicle. I took it back to A+. It had a very small chip on the bottom edge and normal stress caused it to crack. A+ does great work and if there is a real problem with the product or the workmanship, they stand behind it. I can't recommend them highly enough. I will go back to A+ Glass Company for any and all of my auto glass needs.

The tech called when he was on his way and when he arrived.  Very professional and explained care. Very pleased!  Will be calling very soon for the car windshield to be replaced. Very professional and skilled.

resp.text: We really appreciate your business!!  Thank you for the awesome review, but we are A+ Glass Company instead of A1.  No offense taken but just a correction.  Thank you and please call us again.

name: Casey Holmes
text:
I recently had my windshield replaced by these guys, and it couldn't have been any better.  -- Great price, great customer service, quality install, and now my 240sx is a much better car to look at without the eyesore of a smashed windshield.
They installed new rubber sealing along the outside as well, which helps since the old molding was dried up garbage.  Also, my old windshield was a replacement as well (not original Nissan) and was an inferior install to A Glass Company's replacement.
I've already put the car through its paces, out drifting in heavy rain, yet my new windshield is completely leak free -- even with all the added stresses that drifting adds by flexing the car's chassis.
My ALFA insurance agent highly recommended these guys, and I understand why.  I will undoubtedly give them my business again, and I've recommended them to numerous friends.

name: John David
text: I had A Glass come out and install a new windshield on my C3 Corvette. Keith was very prompt in arrival and got straight to work. After removing the old glass he showed me where the frame had some rust and then explained how I could repair it myself and even went so far as to tell me exactly how he would do it if it were in his shop. After repairing the rust I rescheduled for today- and Keith showed up again, cleaned the area, installed the new glass and chrome trim, and installed my new weatherstripping. I could not have asked for a better experience from him. I will be taking all of my cars to him from now on. It is not always easy to find places you can trust- but A Glass is one of them for me.

resp.text: Thank you for your business, we really appreciate it!!!

text:
Absolutely terrible experience. I had my windshield replaced by them and had to be replaced again due to a defect in the replacement windshield and for excessive wind noise. The second install was worse than the first even though I was told it was going to be done properly this time and done by Keith himself. It was absolutely terrible. Any person could look at the seal and tell it was not right. It didn't even cover the glass all the way around. So now I have to have it replaced for the third time and pay for it to be done twice.

I do NOT recommend going to A Glass Company and I will be sure to let anyone I know will know to stay away.

resp.text:
Mr.Bradley,
I am sorry for your inconvenience , and would be happy to refund you the labor fee.You requested the cheapest windshield and molding to be put in your 1998 BMW 528, had you requested the OE replacement you would not have the problems you are having with the fitting to your specification .As you know there was a price difference, your cost was $230.00 and the OE windshield and molding was $846.49.You were pleased with the outcome when you picked up your car, if you had an issue, you should have brought it to my attention. On my part the install looked fine to me.But as I said if you want to drop by we can refund you the labor cost for this job.Sorry for your trouble. The first windshield had a distortion in it that I failed to see upon installing, but I promptly ordered you another one.

I ordered a very, very expensive New front windshield with the original Date Code and the Lof Glass logo engraved on it.  Also, I ordered new old stock, "Original" Stainless trim to put on both the front with the new windshield and they removed and replaced of the original back glass and trim.  They were happy to get me right in and completely explained exactly the procedure for installation and using the correct sealant.  The owners are the best and most humble people and they do better quality work than anyone!  The one person who wrote a negative response on these folks has no idea what they are talking about and their post should not be given any credit whatsoever.

Mark

name: Doug 9044
text:
I contacted these guys to install the rear glass and a new windshield in my 93' Toyota Paseo, nothing out of the ordinary. They come out during normal business hours so I was unable to be there but I had my father let them into my garage. The guy called me and said he's never seen this type of car and he was " pretty sure" he could put the front windshield in right but knew he could do the back. I just told him not to install the front since he had no clue what to do. Then he install the rear with their universal molding, which is fine since Toyota didn't have it available anymore.
I got home and looked over the job, it was horrible. He had installed the rear windshield way out of sort, it wasn't positioned in the opening evenly as it is extremely too far forward, to the point that there's a 3/4 inch gap at the bottom. Even with the gap they only installed their molding around the top and two sides leaving the huge gap in plain sight.
I called the owner the next day and he was horribly rude, told me he wouldn't come back and to take it to a paseo specialist. Clearly I took it to a hack.
I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy, not only do they perform poor installations they owner has a filthy mouth when speaking to you about it.

name: Connor Gaston
text:
They replaced glass on both of my cars. One car wasn't a problem. My SUV was more difficult. I asked for good quality glass and I'm not exactly sure what I got.
I wanted the glass installed following the instructions spelled out in the factory Service Manual. When I would explain to the installers how it NEEDED to be done they pushed back by saying that was not necessary. My SUV has a specific way to install the windshield that is out of the ordinary. If steps aren't followed then its going to leak. They assured me that it wouldn't leak the way they did it and I really did not want to put that to the test with their way of doing it. I supplied my own new factory gasket for the job. If I had not had that they would have reused the 20 year old gasket that was glued to the old windshield. The manual says to use a NEW gasket.

All the glass installers I have delt with to get this done have just about all been the same. They are payed by they job and want to get done and on to the next job. I care about my car and if I'm gong to pay to have this done I want it done right. As the customer they need to consider that I probably have a good idea what I'm talking about and should listen and absorb what I'm telling them because I didn't want it to leak and I know they didn't want to have to come back and fix it.

My experience with the installers that came today was the reason for the bad rating. I don't appreciate their attitude towards my instructions I had for them.  I walked inside to get cash to pay them while they were working and quietly came back outside to hear them talking about me and how I was trying to micromanage them.  One of the guys actually told me he could see why they other companies didn't want to do the job. Which was a rude thing to say. He couldn't handle I wanted things done a certain way (the correct way).

I'm sure most windshields are simple and easy to replace. If you have any specifics on how your car windshield should be done like I did then skip this company. Along with Cassady and Self. They were worse.
